questions.question: What should be done with the prisoner before allowing them into a secure room for a legal visit?

options.b: They should be denied access to the secure room
options.d: They should be questioned by the police

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.14.2.

questions.question: During a legal visit, where should the prisoner be positioned in relation to the police?

options.a: Out of view and out of hearing
options.b: In full view but out of hearing
options.c: In full view and full hearing
options.d: Out of view but in hearing range

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.14.3.

questions.question: What should be done with the prisoner after the legal visit is over?

options.b: They should be locked in a cell
options.c: They should be searched before being returned to the cell
options.d: They should be allowed to leave without any further action

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.14.4.

questions.question: According to the policy, why is it necessary to establish a procedure to ensure the timely court appearance of arrested persons?

options.a: To ensure they receive preferential treatment

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.15 Prisoner's Court Appearance.

questions.question: What requirement does Section 16(2) of the Constitution of Jamaica impose regarding accused individuals?

options.a: They should be denied a fair hearing
options.b: They should be given a fair hearing within an unreasonable time
options.c: They should be given a fair hearing within a reasonable time
options.d: They should not be given a fair hearing

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.15.2.

questions.question: What action should the investigator take to prevent undue delay in compliance with Section 16(2) of the Constitution?

options.a: Delay the case as much as possible
options.b: Submit the case to the court without investigation
options.c: Prepare the case, have it vetted, and submit it to the court promptly
options.d: Avoid submitting the case to the court

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.15.3.

questions.question: When should a person arrested under Section 5(a) of the Unlawful Possession of Property Act be taken before a Parish Judge sitting in court?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.15.4.

questions.question: What should the Custody, Detention, and Courts Officer do when non-Jamaican citizens are arrested or detained?

options.a: Nothing special; treat them like any other detainee
options.b: Notify the authorities of their nationality
options.d: Provide them with free legal representation

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 11.3.7.

questions.question: What is the primary responsibility of the Station Officers/Sub-Officers in charge of Lock-ups?

options.b: To ensure prisoners are not searched
options.c: To ensure the security and safety of prisoners in custody
options.d: To keep cells unlocked at all times

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 11.4.

questions.question: What is the responsibility of the Sub-officer on duty or other police personnel when receiving a prisoner at any police station, as stated in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.a: Provide immediate bail for the prisoner.
options.b: Verify the authenticity of the papers related to the prisoner's detention.
options.c: Release the prisoner if the charge is minor.
options.d: Consult with the judiciary about the prisoner's case.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.1.1.
